about_the_game:
Players explore the world through the perspectives of two individuals, each with their own unique experiences, as they navigate their daily lives in a world where public transportation is free.

The Man's Story

Tired of his monotonous life, the player decides to earn some quick cash by taking part in a venue survey. But just when he’s had enough of his dull routine, he unexpectedly runs into an old friend. Invited over to his friend’s house, he meets the friend’s girlfriend— and that’s when things take a wild turn. What seemed like a casual meeting suddenly drags the player into an unexpected and life-changing event.

The Woman's Story

As part of a team working on autonomous car brake systems, the player is right in the middle of cutting-edge technology. But one day, an unforeseen accident leaves her critically injured, teetering on the edge of life and death. She's offered a radical solution: a surgery that transfers only her brain into another body. When she wakes up, she finds herself in a whole new world—but what awaits her there? And what fate lies ahead?

A world where public transportation is free. However, the price for this convenience is that you must endure endless, mind-numbing ads just to travel.

In a future where anyone can easily print another person's face with a 3D printer, what kind of hopes and despair await?

In organ transplants, compatibility with the donor is crucial. However, when the genetic closeness is too high, a strange irony can occur — the recipient may instinctively reject a part of their own body.

Cars equipped with an automatic braking system. Have you ever wondered how the algorithm behind it really works?

name: The Genetic Dilemma

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Ryzen 3 / Intel Core i3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060

short_description: What if you could transplant your brain into someone else’s body? The Genetic Dilemma is a sci-fi walking simulator set in a future where public transportation is free, exploring the conflicts between technological advancement and human instinct.
